description: Front end to the IPFS a file system that uses similar to BitTorrent protocol from what I understand.

NO http is not dead but we are coming to a new paradigm as far as internet storage is concern. I already have great project for this including a complete crypto currency system that will run autonomously forever.
I have downloaded the software and find it amazingly simple to use.
We will probably see new types of hackers and pirates trying to steel proprietary rights etc. 
Becareful what you upload...
If you want to join me in a IPFS complete crypto project, write to me at lenarval@pm.me

Thanks
Dan

It's not completely decentralized because it uses a blockchain which incorporates a ledger which contains a "fingerprint" of your data and transaction which can be read by those that deployed the blockchain.

Anonymous transactions are a MUST if it is to be truely safe.

I cannot support this at this time.

If you run an NFT project don't pay every month for a pinning service. Grab an optiplex or something similar and run this instead. I have a full Cardano node, minting script and IPFS all running off of an Optiplex I purchased off Ebay. I was spending $125 a month between a Digital Ocean VPS and pinning service through Pinata so this setup has paid for itself in a little over a month.

Connects to a few attached peers, but no more. I recommend that you start by looking at the comics on XKCD Archives. There are hundreds of peers in total, but you won't be able to connect to them. The app is buggy and gives out errors all the time. Pros: The interface looks friendly.
С каждым обновлением по-своему ломают и приходится сносить конфиг папку. Если работает -- не обновляйте, ничего нового все равно не увидите. Протокол консервативен.
